alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 2:29AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Eastern Adams, southwestern Morgan and southeastern Weld. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated another round of heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving across eastern Adams county into southwestern Morgan county. This will cause continued or renewed small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell in this area Thursday afternoon and evening. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northeastern Aurora, Bennett, Wiggins, Hoyt, Leader, Prospect Valley, Roggen, Strasburg, Adena, Manila Village, Twelve-Mile Corner, Watkins and Hoyt Beet Dump.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be alert for possible damage to rural roads.
